title: Strengthening Software Development Practical Skills: IVR Utilization in Higher Education: Design for Language Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device usage skills and understanding of language acquisition theories
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can experience authentic language use scenarios through 360-degree video in an IVR environment and utilize key expressions.
Learners can iteratively improve IVR-based language learning scenarios three or more times using design-based research methodology.
Learners can explain the technical integration process of IVR learning tools (resources, processes, stakeholder collaboration) with over 80% comprehension.
Learners can comparatively analyze the strengths and weaknesses of IVR-based language learning experiences (physical discomfort, emotional responses, learning outcomes).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
